title: A sum of money invested at compound interest amounts to Rs. 800 in 3 years and to Rs. 840 in 4 years. The rate of interest per annum is? - Quora

response.answer_text: Interest on 800 for the fourth year= 840–800 For 800 interest for 1 year is 40. Hence rate of interest, (100 X 40)/800 = 5% Let P be principal at start. P X (105/100)^3 = 800. P X 1.157625 = 800 P = 691.07
Interest for 4- years= ₹840Interest for 3- years=₹ 800So interest for ₹800 amounts to =₹40 annually.Therefore the interest for ₹ 100 amounts to = ₹ 40/800 x 100 = 5%
